2010/1/24 Ken <kstanley@...>
>
> Is the test harness also designed for HyperNEAT experiments? For example, XOR isn't a typical benchmark for HyperNEAT (i.e.
> its network doesn't have regularities and is quite small). Also, it would need to come with a HyperNEAT substrate for XOR. Is that
> really the intent or is it more than there aren't really HyperNEAT-centric experiments at least at the moment?
>

Yes so the test code that's in there currently builds a substrate for
XOR on the basis that (A) I have known-to-be-working XOR code and (B)
I already knew a minimal substrate for XOR - in was a quick way to
test the code in totallity.

The harness builds a suitable substrate and 'wires' it and various
other components together, such as a genome decoder, evaluator,
speciation strategy and evolution algorithm. The problem domains are
completely independent from NEAT or HyperNEAT so all you have to do to
get an existing domain designed for NEAT to work is build a substrate
and switch to using the HyperNEAT genome decoder instead of the Neat
decoder.

BTW do you or anyone here have any ideas about what is a good baseline
problem domain for HyperNEAT? sort of an equivalent to XOR in NEAT.

Colin
